Detailed Description

This class allows to make a Bayesian estimation of an Exponential distribution when the prior distribution of the Exponential parameter is a Gamma distribution.

The conjugacy property of the Gamma distribution with respect to the Exponential distribution ensures that the posterior distribution over the Exponential parameter is itself a Gamma distribution whose parameters can be computed analytically.

An Exponential distribution with learned parameter beta (called scale parameter) has the following probability density function:

A Gamma distribution with parameters alpha and theta follows the following probability density function (for x > mu):

See Also
plLearnExponential plExponential plGamma

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

plBayesLearnExponential::plBayesLearnExponential ( )

Default constructor.

plBayesLearnExponential::plBayesLearnExponential ( plSymbol const &  variable,
plFloat  init_alpha,
plFloat  init_theta,
plFloat  mu = PL_ZERO 
)

Creates a learnable exponential distribution, where the prior over the parameter follows a Gamma distribution.

Parameters
[in]variablethe variable of the learnt distribution
[in]init_alphaInitial value of the alpha parameter of the Gamma distribution over the exponential parameter. Must be strictly positive.
[in]init_thetaInitial value of the beta parameter of the Gamma distribution over the exponential parameter. Must be strictly positive.
[in]muThe shift parameter of the exponential distribution.
plBayesLearnExponential::plBayesLearnExponential ( plSymbol const &  variable)
explicitprotected

Creates a learnable exponential distribution, where the prior over the parameter follows a Gamma distribution.

alpha and theta are initialized arbitrarily to 1. This constructor is here only for use with plCndLearnObject<>, it should be used with care as the arbitrary initialization of alpha and theta generally makes no sense.

virtual plBayesLearnExponential::~plBayesLearnExponential ( )
inlinevirtual

Destructor.

Returns the expectation of the posterior distribution on the exponential parameter given learned data.

plDistribution plBayesLearnExponential::get_aposteriori_distribution ( plVariablesConjunction const &  beta) const
virtual

Returns the Gamma distribution corresponding to the posterior distribution over the exponential parameter knowing all learned data.

Parameters
[in]betaVariable that corresponds to the exponential parameter, on which to build the posterior distribution. Must be a variable with a real type.

Implements plBayesLearnObject.

unsigned int plBayesLearnExponential::get_n_parameters ( ) const
inlinevirtual

Returns the ACTUAL number of parameters.

It could be different from the number of parameters returned by get_parameters.

For example, the actual number of parameters of a N dimensional normal distribution is N + N*(N+1)/2 because the covariance matrix is symmetric.

Implements plLearnObject.

void plBayesLearnExponential::get_parameters ( plValues &  params) const
inlinevirtual

Returns all learnt parameters of the object (parameters passed to the distribution constructors when calling 'get_distribution').

This virtual method has to be implemented in all derived classes.

Implements plNonCndLearnObject.
